attributes.text: Basic class for all core and combination effects.
The DOM element
This event is fired when effect ends.
This event is fired when effect starts.
This event is fired every time a frame is rendered.
Current value
Previous value
Apply method for duration. Should be overwritten if needed.
Returns the effect’s DOM element
the element
the element
Sets the element to be animated.
This internal function is called after the effect actually has ended.
This internal function is called before “afterFinished” and after the effect actually has ended.
This internal function is called after the effect’s “setup” method has been called.
This internal function is called before “afterSetup” and after the effect’s “setup” method has been called.
This internal function is called each time after the effect’s “update” method is called.
This internal function is called before “afterUpdate” and each time after the effect’s “update” method is called.
This internal function is called before the effect actually ends.
This internal function is called before “beforeFinished” and before the effect actually ends.
This internal function is called before the effect’s “setup” method gets called.
This internal function is called before “beforeSetup” and before the effect’s “setup” method gets called.
This internal function is called before the effect actually starts.
This internal function is called before “beforeStartInternal” and before the effect actually starts.
This internal function is each time before the effect’s “update” method is called.
This internal function is called before “beforeUpdateInternal” and each time before the effect’s “update” method is called.
Removes effect from queue and sets state to finished.
Ends the effect

This internal function is called when the effect has finished.

Fires “finish” event.

Returns the (computed) value of the property delay.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #delay}.
(Computed) value of delay.

Returns the (computed) value of the property duration.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #duration}.
(Computed) value of duration.

Returns the (computed) value of the property fps.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #fps}.
(Computed) value of fps.

Returns the (computed) value of the property from.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #from}.
(Computed) value of from.

Returns the (computed) value of the property queue.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #queue}.
(Computed) value of queue.

Returns the (computed) value of the property sync.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #sync}.
(Computed) value of sync.

Returns the (computed) value of the property to.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #to}.
(Computed) value of to.

Returns the (computed) value of the property transition.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #transition}.
(Computed) value of transition.
This internal function is used to update properties before the effect starts.
Initial value for property delay.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property delay with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #delay}.
the default value
Initial value for property duration.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property duration with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #duration}.
the default value
Initial value for property fps.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property fps with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #fps}.
the default value
Initial value for property from.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property from with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #from}.
the default value
Initial value for property queue.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property queue with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #queue}.
the default value
Initial value for property sync.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property sync with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #sync}.
the default value
Initial value for property to.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property to with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #to}.
the default value
Initial value for property transition.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property transition with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #transition}.
the default value

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property sync equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #sync}.
Whether the property equals true.
Effect’s step on duration between 0 (just started) and 1 (finished). The longer the duration is, the lower is each step.
Invokes update() if effect’s remaining duration is bigger than zero, or ends the effect otherwise.

Effect’s step on duration between 0 (just started) and 1 (finished). The longer the duration is, the lower is each step.

Fires “update” event.
Calls update(), or invokes the effect, if not running.

Resets the user value of the property delay.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #delay}.

Resets the user value of the property duration.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

This internal function is called before the effect starts to configure the element or prepare other effects.

Fires “setup” event.
Starts the effect

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property sync.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #sync}.
the new value
Animation setup as Number between 0 and 1.

This internal function is called each time the effect performs an step of the animation.

Sub classes will overwrite this to perform the actual changes on element properties.
Number of seconds the effect should wait before start.
Number of seconds the effect should run.
Number frames per seconds the effect should be rendered with.
Initial value of effect-specific property (color, opacity, position, etc.).
Name of queue the effect should run in.
Flag indicating if effect should run parallel with others.
End value of effect-specific property. When this value is reached, the effect will end.
Function which modifies the effect-specific property during the transition between “from” and “to” value.
